business.headline: Buying a LIC policy? Here's where your money goes and what you get backWith assets under management of over Rs 57 lakh crore, LIC is not just an insurance company but also one of India's biggest long-term investors.
Sensex ends 245 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; TCS down 2%Sensex ends 245 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; TCS down 2%

US targets Iran trading partners with 25% tariff: Will India be impacted?Markets in India have turned cautious as investors assess whether stricter US penalties on countries trading with Iran could have a spillover impact on Indian exporters, oil trade and overall market sentiment.

When can you withdraw 100% of your PF money? EPFO rules explainedWithdrawing your provident fund money has often felt complicated for many employees. Recent changes by EPFO now clearly explain when members can withdraw their full PF balance.

Will Budget 2026 simplify tax rules for investors?As policymakers prepare Budget 2026, tax experts and investors are hoping for tax changes that make savings and investments simpler, fairer and more predictable.

HIP, TIP before SIP: Experts take on smart financial planningMany investors focus on SIPs to build wealth, but experts say protection should come first. Health and term insurance can safeguard savings and ensure long-term financial plans stay on track during emergencies.

Affordable housing is shrinking in India. Can Budget 2026 fix the problem?Industry experts warn that India is heading towards a divided housing market. Can Budget 2026 bridge the growing gap between luxury and affordable homes?

Budget 2026: Will healthcare get better access and patient-first reforms?With Budget 2026 around the corner, healthcare stakeholders are calling for reforms that put patients first. Better access, affordable treatment and stronger preventive care remain top priorities for the sector.

Kotak Mahindra stock split: Did private lender's shares really crash 80% today?At first glance, the share fall caused concern among investors tracking the stock. However, the sharp fall was not due to any problem in the bank's business or financial health.

Housing demand falls after 2 years. Is it an opportunity for homebuyers?For homebuyers planning a purchase, this phase offers more options, steadier prices, and room to negotiate, but choosing the right location and builder matters more than chasing short-term discounts.

Vedanta share price jumps 6%: Why is the stock rising today?The rally was driven by a combination of positive brokerage commentary, renewed focus on the company's proposed demerger, and firm momentum in the metals and mining space.

Gold and silver prices continue to rally: Buy now or wait for a dip?With gold and silver near record highs, investors face a choice between chasing momentum or waiting for pullbacks. Price levels, support zones, and timing will decide near-term returns for portfolios.

NPS, PF withdrawal rule changes: What you can take out and whenNPS and EPF withdrawal rules have changed, affecting how much money can be accessed and when. From early exits to emergency withdrawals, here is what subscribers should check now.
Muted start on Dalal Street as benchmark indices drift lowerThe S&P BSE Sensex was up marginally by 15.58 points to 83,643.27, while the NSE Nifty50 added 7.95 points to 25,740.25 as of 9:23 am.

BCCL IPO allotment today: What listing gains can investors expect?BCCL IPO: The public listing opened for subscription on January 9, 2026, and closed on January 13, 2026. Shares are scheduled to list on the BSE and NSE on January 16, 2026.

BCCL IPO allotment out: Check your status, listing date, and GMPBharat Coking Coal IPO saw extraordinary demand across all investor categories by the time bidding closed on January 13, 2026. BCCL IPO was subscribed 143.85 times overall.

Dalal Street's worst new year in a decade. Should investors worry?After being among the worst-performing major global markets in 2025, Dalal Street has continued to lag peers at the start of the new year, weighed down by global uncertainty and cautious investor sentiment.

That jerk will be gone soon: Trump slams Fed Chair Powell in Detroit speechUS President Donald Trump has repeatedly clashed with the Fed Chief over its rate strategy, pressing for faster cuts to boost growth and manufacturing. He argues that lower rates would supercharge investment and help ease pressure on consumers.

50% or 75%? How much US tariff could India face after Iran moveThe concern centres on a proposed 25% US tariff on nations maintaining commercial ties with Iran. While a 25% levy may appear manageable on its own, market participants fear it could be imposed over and above existing duties, taking the total tariff burden to as much as 75%.

EPS pensioners can now get digital life certificates at home for free: Here's howThe move is aimed at making life easier for elderly pensioners and those who find it difficult to visit banks, EPFO offices or use smartphones for the annual life certificate process.

entertainment.headline: Aamir Khan all set for Rajkumar Hirani's Dadasaheb Phalke biopic. Shoot details out Aamir Khan and Rajkumar Hirani are set to start filming their biopic on Dadasaheb Phalke. The project has not been put on a burner as rumours suggested earlier.

Celina Jaitly says estranged husband blocks access to children: They're brainwashed Celina Jaitly has spoken about her ongoing custody dispute with her estranged husband, Peter Haag, stating she has been unable to communicate with her three sons, despite an Austrian court order granting joint custody. The actor alleged interference, financial difficulties, and challenges in securing her rights since returning to India.

Anaganaga Okka Raju review: A breezy rural comedy driven by clean humourRelease Date:Wed Jan 14, 2026 Anaganaga Okka Raju film review: This Naveen Polishetty-Meenakshi Chaudhary starrer Sankranthi release is a typical rural comedy drama that is familiar, funny, emotional and engaging.

Vaa Vaathiyaar review: Karthi shines but film doesn't match its quirky promiseRelease Date:Wed Jan 14, 2026 Vaa Vaathiyaar movie review: Director Nalan Kumarasamy's Vaa Vaathiyaar, starring Karthi, Sathyaraj and Krithi Shetty, is a quirky comedy that doubles up as a superhero drama. While the film presents a unique concept, it didn't explore its full potential.

JioStar's Alok Jain on KKK, Bigg Boss: Want to create formats that can go global JioStar's Alok Jain confirmed 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' returns this year after the IPL (Indian Premiere League), while explaining the decision to merge 'Bigg Boss' into a single, screen-agnostic format. He also emphasised the vision to develop homegrown Indian IPs that can eventually achieve global success.

Sussanne Khan's late birthday wish for Hrithik Roshan features sons, Saba. Video Sussanne Khan shared a heartfelt video collage a few days after Hrithik Roshan's birthday, to wish the star. The video featured their sons, besides Hrithik's partner Saba Azad and Sussanne's partner Arsalan.

Hrithik Roshan's Kaabil 2 in the works; Sanjay Gupta promises a deadlier sequel Sanjay Gupta confirmed the sequel to his 2017 action-thriller 'Kaabil' in response to a social media post. The movie featured Hrithik Roshan and Yami Gautam in pivotal characters.

Vir Das reacts to Happy Patel CBFC certification: Only A I've ever received Vir Das's spy comedy Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos has been cleared by the CBFC with an 'A' certificate ahead of its January 16 theatrical release, requiring only minimal edits.

Parasakthi team celebrates Pongal with PM Modi in Delhi, GV Prakash shares glimpse Sudha Kongara's Parasakthi team met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi over Pongal. Composer GV Prakash performed a track from his Tamil pride album Thiruvaasagam for the PM, marking a proud moment for the film and Tamil cinema.

Meet Chandni Bhabhda: From mimicking Alia Bhatt to co-starring with Ananya Panday Chandni Bhabhda, a popular content creator with over 500k followers known for mimicking celebrities including Alia Bhatt, discussed landing a role in Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri, and her experiences with the cast, particularly Ananya Panday.

Aditi Rao Hydari showers praise on Haq, calls Yami Gautam's film unforgettable Aditi Rao Hydari praised Haq starring Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi, calling it a beautifully crafted and emotionally powerful film that stayed with her long after watching.

Viral video: Disha Patani, Talwiinder spark buzz at Nupur Sanon-Stebin Ben reception A video from Nupur Sanon and Stebin Ben's wedding reception showing Disha Patani with a man believed to be singer Talwiinder Singh Sidhu has gone viral. This has led to widespread speculation about their relationship.

Is Shraddha Kapoor marrying Rahul Mody? Brother Siddhanth responds Rumours regarding Shraddha Kapoor's potential wedding in Udaipur have circulated widely on social media, prompting her brother Siddhanth Kapoor to address the speculation and clarify the family's position.

Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu delivers strong opening for Chiranjeevi Chiranjeevi's latest action-comedy, Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu, earned over Rs 61 crore in two days. It marked a strong comeback after previous setbacks and outpaced recent films in domestic collections.

Shahid's O' Romeo in legal heat, Hussain Ustara's daughter demands Rs 1 crore A legal dispute has surfaced over Shahid Kapoor's film O' Romeo, with Sanober Shaikh alleging unauthorised use of her late father Hussain Ustara's likeness and story. The filmmakers deny these claims, stating the film is fictional and any resemblance to real persons is purely coincidental.

Yuzvendra Chahal reacts to reunion rumours with ex-wife Dhanashree Verma on The 50 Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal has clarified that reports about his reunion with ex-wife Dhanashree Verma on the reality show The 50 are unfounded, urging media and fans to refrain from spreading unverified claims.

Radhika Apte on long shifts in Bollywood: I've had arguments with producers Radhika Apte spoke out against long working hours in Bollywood, saying she has often argued with producers for refusing extended shifts. The actor stressed the need for a five-day work week and 12-hour shifts, adding to the ongoing industry debate on work-life balance.

Emraan Hashmi says men used to initially hate him: They thought I was privileged Emraan Hashmi opened up about the unexpected rise in his popularity following his cameo in The Ba***ds of Bollywood. He also shared insights on how evolving audience tastes and OTT platforms influence his choice of varied roles.

Emraan Hashmi shares why Awarapan 2 took 19 years to happen Emraan Hashmi revealed the reasons behind the nearly two-decade delay of Awarapan 2 and discussed recent security measures on set following leaked images.

general news.headline: Leave Iran immediately: India tells nationals amid worsening unrestAs the death toll in Iran protests crossed 2,000, the Indian Embassy in Iran asked all nationals - including students, pilgrims, businesspersons and tourists - to leave the country using available means, including commercial flights.

Trinamool plea to protect I-PAC data 'seized' by ED disposed of after agency says nothing collected in raidsTrinamool plea to protect I-PAC data 'seized' by ED disposed of after agency says nothing collected in raids

Teen abducted, raped by Pak grooming gang in London, 200 Sikhs come to her rescueAccording to a report by the Sikh Press Association, the accused, believed to be in his early 40s and known for suspiciously "befriending" under-16s in West London's Hounslow area, began forming a relationship with the Sikh girl when she was around 13 years old.

Iran protester, 26, to be executed today, family got just 10 minutes for final meetErfan Soltani, a 26-year-old Iranian, is set to be executed in public today, in Iran's first death sentence linked to the anti-Khamenei protests, which entered its 20th day on Wednesday. The Khamenei regime moved fast from his "trial" to the execution stage. Soltani's family got just 10 minutes to say goodbye to him.

India plans rocket-missile force with eye on Pak. What it can learn from IranThe Army chief has said India is raising a rocket-cum-missile force, especially because both China and Pakistan have a dedicated unit on similar lines. However, India should look to Iran, which arguably has the world's largest and most potent missile force.

Faced power cuts in Denmark: Kidambi Srikanth defends India Open amid criticismIndia Open 2026: Former world No. 1 Kidambi Srikanth defended playing conditions in New Delhi while responding to criticism from Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt, who said she experienced unclean and unhygienic training conditions in the capital on Tuesday.

2nd ODI Live: Rahul, Jadeja rebuild after Kohli departsIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ), 2nd ODI Live score: India (160 for 4 in 34 overs). KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja have rebuilt the Indian innings after a flurry of wickets went down, including that of Virat Kohli, who got out after scoring 23 off 29.

Girls educated in south, kept as slaves in north: DMK's Dayanidhi Maran sparks rowDMK's Dayanidhi Maran claimed that restricting education to Hindi alone contributes to unemployment in other regions, while Tamil Nadu's Dravidian model promotes equal access to education for both girls and boys.

End of the Raider: How Mahmud Ghazni's empire went up in flamesMahmud Ghazni plundered India for 24 years, sacking temples like Somnath. His empire crumbled after his death, ending in flames. It was poetic justice for his brutal raids.

Warned about terrorism for 40 years, what was done? Indian envoy slams CanadaIndian envoy to Canada, Dinesh Patnaik, slammed Canada for failing to act against terrorism on its soil, which he said New Delhi has warned about for 40 years. "What has anyone done about it? Not one person has been convicted here," he asked.

US drug crisis is homegrown, not Venezuelan, expert on Fareed Zakaria showAmid repeated claims by the US that the Maduro regime fuelled America's drug crisis, drug historian David Herzberg broke down who he says is really responsible. Herzberg blamed US pharmaceutical companies and the government for getting Americans hooked on opioids that later spilt into illicit use.

Palak paneer and prejudice: Indian students win Rs 1.8-crore lawsuit in USIndian PhD students Aditya Prakash and Urmi Bhattacheryya also argued that departmental kitchen rules at the University of Colorado Boulder singled out South Asians, discouraging community members from opening their lunches in common areas.

Viral Toxic teaser actor Beatriz Taufenbach deletes Instagram after backlashComplaints from political and social groups have emerged over alleged graphic content in the teaser for Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups featuring Beatriz Taufenbach, and there has been social media backlash, too. This has prompted the actor to delete her Instagram account.

Trump warns Iran against executing protesters, Tehran calls him main killer Live updatesWithout offering specifics, President Donald Trump said that the US would take "very strong action" if Iran began executing protesters. "If they hang them, you're going to see some things," he said.

50% or 75%? How much US tariff could India face after Iran moveThe concern centres on a proposed 25% US tariff on nations maintaining commercial ties with Iran. While a 25% levy may appear manageable on its own, market participants fear it could be imposed over and above existing duties, taking the total tariff burden to as much as 75%.

India Open: After hygiene row, World No. 2 says polluted Delhi unfit for badmintonWorld No. 2 Anders Antonsen revealed why he was not a part of the India Open in Delhi, citing extreme air pollution as the reason, raising fresh concerns over player safety and tournament conditions. His statement came a day after his compatriot Mia Blichfeldt called out unhygienic training conditions in New Delhi.

Rs 6,75,00,000: That's how much Nasa is offering for cooking Mars foodNasa has launched the Deep Space Food Challenge: Mars to Table, offering a $750,000 (Rs 6.75 crore) prize for an innovative galactic menu. This competition aims to solve the culinary crisis for astronauts on the three-year journey to Mars.

Students now earn up to Rs 65,000 a month from gigs, beating many entry-level jobsIndia's students are no longer earning just pocket money. A new data-led report shows college students making up to Rs 65,000 a month through gig work, with earnings often covering rent, food, and daily expenses. The findings reveal how student gigs are evolving into a critical financial lifeline across metros and tier-2 cities.

I don't know how he's alive: Robert Kennedy Jr describes Trump's dietUS Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr said Trump eats healthy at home but relies on fast food while traveling, dismissing health concerns as the president faces scrutiny over age, stamina and diet.

Trump shadow over Brics war games? Iran 'forced to withdraw' last minuteLast week, South Africa quietly asked Iran to scale back or withdraw its participation from the Brics naval exercise off its coast. It underlines South Africa's Catch-22 situation - adhering to commitments of the Brics while not annoying Trump.

Your coffee tastes better today, thanks to one woman's experimentMelitta Bentz invented the paper coffee filter in her kitchen, revolutionising filtration methods. Her discovery highlights the overlooked impact of women's domestic innovations on global health.

'Constant confusion' over CM issue, Siddaramaiah seeks clarity from Rahul GandhiKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has sought clarity from Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on the state leadership tussle, asserting there was "constant confusion" on the issue, sources told India Today TV.

What is Trump's staircase model that's delaying India-US trade deal?The Trump administration's deal-making operates less like traditional diplomacy and more like a business sprint. Countries are rewarded for a speedy decision and penalised for delay. A missed deadline might have cost India an early advantage in trade talks, according to Trump aide Howard Lutnick. Here's all about the 'staircase' approach.
The world's strongest passports list is out. India ranks…The Henley Passport Index 2026 has ranked India at the 80th spot, five places higher than last year.

sports.headline: Wahab Riaz named as Pakistan women's team mentor after World Cup debacle Wahab Riaz has been appointed as mentor for the Pakistan women's cricket team for their upcoming white-ball tour of South Africa, with the appointment confirmed by the Pakistan Cricket Board. The tour, set to begin February 10, marks the team's first series since finishing last at the ICC Women's World Cup, and includes new faces as well as key recalls in both T20I and ODI squads.

Faced power cuts in Denmark: Kidambi Srikanth defends India Open amid criticism India Open 2026: Former world No. 1 Kidambi Srikanth defended playing conditions in New Delhi while responding to criticism from Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt, who said she experienced unclean and unhygienic training conditions in the capital on Tuesday.

Virat Kohli returns to No. 1 spot after 4 years, Rohit Sharma drops to third ICC ODI Rankings: Virat Kohli returned to the No. 1 spot in the ODI batting charts for the first time in four years. He rose to the top spot after a sensational run in the 50-over format since his return to competitive action in October.

Rajkot ODI: No debut for Ayush Badoni as India pick Washington Sundar replacement India vs New Zealand, 2nd ODI: India picked fast-bowling all-rounder Niitsh Kumar Reddy as Washington Sundar's replacement for the second ODI in Rajkot on Wednesday. Ayush Badoni, who was handed his maiden call-up, will have to wait for his first chance to play for the senior national team.

Josh Hazlewood confident of T20 World Cup 2026 return after injury setbacks Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood is confident of being fit for the T20 World Cup in Sri Lanka next month after an injury-hit summer, with the fast bowler targeting a warm-up game ahead of Australia's opening match on February 11.

India Open: After hygiene row, World No. 2 says polluted Delhi unfit for badminton World No. 2 Anders Antonsen revealed why he was not a part of the India Open in Delhi, citing extreme air pollution as the reason, raising fresh concerns over player safety and tournament conditions. His statement came a day after his compatriot Mia Blichfeldt called out unhygienic training conditions in New Delhi.

Kohli's conversion rate puts him ahead of Rohit Sharma in ODIs: Former batter Mohammad Kaif praises Virat Kohli's impressive conversion rate in ODI cricket, saying it puts him ahead of Rohit Sharma in ODI cricket. Kohli scored 93 (91) in the first ODI against New Zealand in Vadodara.

Ayush Badoni's ODI selection unfair: Kris Srikkanth alleges favouritism in explosive take IND vs NZ: Former selector Kris Srikkanth has slammed Ayush Badoni's ODI selection as unfair, questioning the yardstick used by selectors and alleging favouritism after consistent performers were overlooked.

WPL 2026: Meg Lanning set for emotional reunion as Capitals, Warriorz seek redemption WPL 2026, DC vs UPW: Meg Lanning is all set for an emotional reunion with the Delhi Capitals as UP Warriorz look to bounce back following back-to-back defeats in the competition.

Multiple injuries ring alarm bells for India's T20 World Cup title defence at home India's preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026 face hurdles due to injuries to key players namely Tilak Varma and Washington Sundar. The unforeseen injuries have hampered India's preparedness ahead of their title defence at home.

Tennis player forgets tie-break rules, celebrates early and suffers crushing loss Sebastian Ofner's early celebration backfired in stunning fashion as Nishesh Basavareddy staged a dramatic comeback to win a chaotic Australian Open qualifier tiebreak 13–11.

2nd ODI Live: Rahul, Jadeja steady after Kohli departsIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ), 2nd ODI Live score: India (148 for 4 in 32 overs). Virat Kohli has been dismissed for 23 (29) as wickets continue to tumble for India amid some very disciplined from the Kiwis. Shreyas Iyer has been dismissed for 8 (17) against Kristian Clarke as wickets continue to tumble for India.

Grace Hayden on her dad's gamble on Joe Root, India connection and foray into tennisGrace Hayden talks about her father Matthew Hayden's risky Joe Root bet, the overwhelming love she receives from Indian fans, and why she's excited to step beyond cricket and into the world of tennis broadcasting.

Fit and fierce PV Sindhu targets World Championships, Asian Games in 2026India's star shuttler PV Sindhu has returned to full fitness. Sindhu made a tremendous return to Malaysia Masters, the first competition of the season, and is now ready for a long series which includes the World Championships and Asian Games.

T20 World Cup: Visas denied to Pakistan-origin USA players? Here's the truthPakistani-origin USA players are facing visa delays ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026 hosted by India and Sri Lanka. However, there have been widespread reports claiming their visas have been denied.

Henry Nicholls backs inexperienced New Zealand side to bounce back in RajkotNew Zealand batter Henry Nicholls has backed their inexperienced side to bounce back in the second ODI against India in Rajkot. The Kiwis lost the first match by four wickets and are trailing by 0-1 in three-match series.

Confident India target ODI series win in Rajkot despite injury concernsThe Indian side will look to seal yet another white-ball series and avoid further injury concerns when they take on New Zealand in the second ODI at the Niranjan Shah Stadium in Rajkot on Wednesday.

India to revise ODI batting template after T20 World Cup: Batting coachIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said the team would need to revise its ODI batting template after the T20 World Cup in March, especially in light of the new rule that brings in a second ball after the 34th over. As per the change in playing conditions, bowling teams have to pick any one of the two balls to continue bowling from overs 35-50.

MI vs GG: Harmanpreet Kaur becomes first Indian to reach 1000 runs in WPL historyHarmanpreet Kaur became the first Indian cricketer to cross the 1,000-run mark in the Women's Premier League, producing a commanding knock to lead the Mumbai Indians to yet another victory over the Gujarat Giants.

Harmanpreet Kaur haunts Gujarat again as Mumbai Indians make it 8-0 against GiantsWPL 2026, MI vs GG: Harmanpreet Kaur scored an unbeaten 71 as Mumbai Indians beat the Gujarat Giants by seven wickets on Tuesday after chasing down 193 with four balls to spare at the DY Patil Stadium.

Pakistan-born USA pacer claims India visa denied ahead of T20 World Cup: ReportUSA fast bowler Ali Khan has claimed his Indian visa application has been denied less than a month before the ICC Men's T20 World Cup begins, adding a fresh layer of uncertainty to the Americans' preparations for the tournament.

Arbeloa reveals Alonso wished him well after he became Real Madrid's new managerÁlvaro Arbeloa said Xabi Alonso reached out to wish him well after his appointment as Real Madrid manager, underlining that their friendship remains strong despite their new roles.

Who is Ayushi Soni? Gujarat Giants batter becomes first to be retired out in WPLAyushi Soni made WPL history by becoming the first batter to be retired out, a tactical move that helped Gujarat Giants post 192 against Mumbai Indians in Women's Premier League 2026.

IND vs NZ, 2nd ODI: Predicted XI: Will Gautam Gambhir hand Ayush Badoni ODI debut?IND vs NZ, 2nd ODI: Ayush Badoni could make his debut in the Rajkot ODI, after batting coach Sitanshu Kotak explained that India included her to provide an additional bowling option alongside their existing five bowlers.

No communication breakdown between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli: Batting coachIND vs NZ: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak has dismissed rumours of a communication breakdown between senior batters Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma and head coach Gautam Gambhir, insisting the team remains fully focused on its World Cup preparations.

India Open pigeon free: Badminton body rebuffs Danish shuttler's hygiene complaintIndia Open 2026: Badminton Association of India general secretary Sanjay Mishra clarified that hygiene complaints were about the training hall, not the main arena, after Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt flagged unhealthy warm-up conditions at the India Open on Tuesday.

England do not have a drinking problem: Broad dismisses Ashes tour criticismFormer England seamer Stuart Broad has insisted that the current England team do not have a drinking problem, despite a series of alcohol-related incidents over the winter in the Ashes.

India coach backs Ayush Badoni's ODI selection: No team goes in with five bowlersIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said Ayush Badoni was picked for the remaining ODIs to add bowling depth after Washington Sundar's injury, stressing India cannot risk playing with a five-bowler attack.

Lakshya Sen weaponises familiarity to spoil Ayush Shetty's India Open debutYoung Indian shuttler Ayush Shetty endured a forgettable outing at the India Open Super 750 as he bowed out in the opening round against former champion and training partner Lakshya Sen.

Ayush Badoni-less Delhi knocked out as Vidarbha reaches semisVidarbha booked their place in the Vijay Hazare Trophy semi-finals for the second consecutive season with a 76-run victory over a depleted Delhi side. Delhi's campaign ended at the quarter-final stage as they struggled in the absence of Ayush Badoni, who was on national duty, and the injured skipper Rishabh Pant.

MI vs GG Highlights: MI (193/3 in 19.2 ov), Mumbai end Gujarat's unbeaten runMumbai Indians Women (MI) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GG) Highlights: Harmanpreet Kaur has hit a superb fifty to help Mumbai Indians chase down their highest-ever WPL target and make it eight out of eight wins against Gujarat Giants.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
